feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student describes a working budget analyzer that accepts Excel/PDF inputs and produces summaries, risk flags, recommendations, and visualizations, and reports successful testing by a peer. Implement and Validate/Reflect evidence demonstrate the tool was built and functions as a financial application, meeting the pass criterion.


AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT:
- Integrate AI: The student clearly used AI assistance to generate code and source an API key and built a working budget analyzer that produced recommendations (Implement/Validate). However, the submission lacks detailed evidence of deep AI integration within the tool itself (e.g., how AI powers the analysis or examples of AI-driven outputs), so the integration is real and valuable but not demonstrated thoroughly enough for a full PASS.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "This is a student organization budget analyzer. And essentially what you do is ... a PDF file or an Excel file ... you're going to be able to drop the file in here. And based off of the data ... this will give you sort of an overview of your budget and ... give you a suggestion."
"I was able to kind of use the assistance of AI to sort of generate all the necessary background code"
"one of my partners ... was able to input their fraternity budget into the framework here that I created and it was able to give them some recommendations"
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover: identified budgeting problem for peers (motivated the app). Implement: built the analyzer using AI-generated code and an API key, integrated into Replit. Validate/Reflect: tested with a partner and observed actionable output and recommendations.
criteria.reasoning: The student describes a working budget analyzer that accepts Excel/PDF inputs and produces summaries, risk flags, recommendations, and visualizations, and reports successful testing by a peer. Implement and Validate/Reflect evidence demonstrate the tool was built and functions as a financial application, meeting the pass criterion.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "I was able to kind of use the assistance of AI to sort of generate all the necessary background code"

"So now the next question is I guess to evolve and we have here ... this is my project that I was able to create. This is a student organization budget analyzer." (Implement/Validate — DRIVER showing product built and tested)

"I initially was going to do something where I was going to create a new G GPT model um within Open AI but then I realized that uh I had to pay you know a bunch of feed for that and it really just it wasn't going to work out."
criteria.driver_alignment: Implement — student used AI to generate code and obtain an API key to build the analyzer; Reflect — student discusses what they learned about using AI APIs and value; Discover/Validate — identified budgeting problem and demonstrated the tool producing recommendations.
criteria.reasoning: The student clearly used AI assistance to generate code and source an API key and built a working budget analyzer that produced recommendations (Implement/Validate). However, the submission lacks detailed evidence of deep AI integration within the tool itself (e.g., how AI powers the analysis or examples of AI-driven outputs), so the integration is real and valuable but not demonstrated thoroughly enough for a full PASS.
